Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=US-ASCII;
	format=flowed;
	delsp=yes
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I've been capturing verbs, headers, and status codes on my REST/WOA  
wiki. So far, it only covers HTTP/1.1 and WebDAV, but it has already  
been invaluable in my work: http://restpatterns.org

- Steve

--------------
Steve G. Bjorg
http://mindtouch.com
http://twitter.com/bjorg

On Nov 20, 2008, at 6:58 AM, Julian Reschke wrote:

> Miika Makinen wrote:
> >
> >
> > I'm not sure if these are standardized but verbs useful for blogs  
> come
> > to mind, like COMMENT or TRACKBACK
> >
> >
> > Interesting question and I was suprised that first things coming  
> to mind
> > (LOCK/UNLOCK, MOVE/COPY, MERGE/REPLACE) already exist in some  
> form. Nice
> > list at http://annevankeste ren.nl/2007/ 10/http-methods
> > <http://annevankesteren.nl/2007/10/http-methods>
> > ...
>
> A better list (in that it keeps getting updated) is at
> <http://svn.tools.ietf.org/svn/wg/httpbis/draft-ietf-httpbis-method-registrations/latest/draft-ietf-httpbis-method-registrations.html#updated.registry.contents 
> >.
>
> BR, Julian
>
> 


--Apple-Mail-8--219517787

	charset=US-ASCII
